docs.title: What 🎯
docs.text: This site is a demo (and testing laboratory) for MkDocs Material Theme, the popular, python-based static site builder.

docs.title: How To 📋
docs.text:
• Run locally
  • Deploy options - Github, Cloudflare, Vercel

docs.title: My Enhancements ⚙️
docs.text:
I hacked around to make MkDocs more compatible with Obsidian & create some fun themes that resemble famous documentation.

  • MkDocs for Obsidian
  • Famous CSS for MkDocs

docs.title: Premium 💼
docs.text: Mostly testing multi-user.

docs.title: Standard Features 📦
docs.text:
• Blog
  • Top bar

This site is powered by & configured to visually and functionally work well with Obsidian.md, the popular note taking app.

If working in Obsidian or any markdown notes app, it's best to have the flexibility to place markdown files in the root directory, or anywhere you wish, and this configuration allows for this, bypassing the normal need to place files in the /docs/ directory, among a handful of other features summarized below.

docs.title: Hidden Config Folder
docs.text: Moves all config files to a hidden .mkdocs directory so not visible in Obsidian

docs.title: Custom CSS
docs.text: Adds a custom.css file that mirrors default Obsidian theme.

docs.title: Logo and Favicons
docs.text: Adds Obsidian logo and favicon for fun!

docs.title: SameDir
docs.text: Allows for markdown docs to live in the root directory instead of "/docs/" which makes it much nice when integrating many git repos into one vault -- just the ability to keep any folder structure desired.

docs.title: Roamlinks
docs.text: This plugin allows for wikilinks support ... presumably it scans the entire directory for the filename and then gets the full path and inserts it as in normal markdown and required for a normal website.

docs.title: Feature Tests
docs.text: ✅ = Obsidian + Website compatible

docs.title: Styles ✅
docs.text:
• Sidebars - left and right sidebars added
  • Dark and light theme - Uses CSS vars for easy modification
  • Vertical bars - Added to theme to show expanded navigation, as in default Obsidian

docs.title: WikiLinks ✅
docs.text: This link to the Sample page was initially just written as [Sample](<./Sample.md>) in Obsidian and converted by the SamDir plugin during the build process.

docs.title: Mermaid diagrams ✅
docs.text:
Here's the example from MkDocs Material documentation: 

graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Error?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Hmm...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Yay!];

docs.title: LaTeX Math Support ✅
docs.text:
Inline math looks like \(f(x) = x^2\). The input for this is $f(x) = x^2$. Use $...$.

For a block of math, use $$...$$ on separate lines

$$
F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4
$$

converts to

\[ F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4 \]

docs.title: Text Formatting ✅
docs.text:
You can have lists like this

  • first
  • second
  • third

Or checklist lists to

  • Get
  • things
  • done

Also, get highlights and strikethroughs as above (similar to Obsidian). More formatting options for your webpage here. (but not compatible with Obsidian)

docs.title: 4️⃣ Deploy to a website
docs.text:

  • Click on pages to make sure pages deployment is active and check to see if link has been created
